questions.question_text:
You have a Microsoft 365 tenant that uses Microsoft Intune.
You use the Company Portal app to access and install published apps to enrolled devices.
From the Microsoft Endpoint Manager admin center, you add a Microsoft Store app.
Which two App information types are visible in the Company Portal?
NOTE: Each correct selection is worth one point.

discussion.content:
Given answer are wrong. The right answer are:
Information URL: The information URL will be visible to users in Company Portal.
Privacy URL: The privacy URL will be visible to users in Company Portal.

As for the wrong answers:
Developer: This information will be visible to people signed into the admin center.
Owner: This name will be visible to people signed in to the admin center.

Source: Intune, App blade

comments.content: BieLey is correct. Information & Privacy URL will be displayed in company portal. Information can be found on endpoint manager when mousing over the ? next to Information URL/Privacy URL in adding application window.

discussion.content: A and C 100%. Tested on my organization's Company portal
A and C is correct

Selected Answer: AC
Tested
AC are correct. Tested on Intune
a nd c just tested myself

Selected Answer: AC
Information URL
Privacy URL

Selected Answer: AC
The right answer are:
Information URL: The information URL will be visible to users in Company Portal.
Privacy URL: The privacy URL will be visible to users in Company Portal.

choices.B: Group1, Group2, Group3, and Group4 only
choices.C: Admin1, Group1, Group2, Group3, and Group4

questions.question_text:
You need to capture the required information for the sales department computers to meet the technical requirements.
Which Windows PowerShell command should you run first?

comments.content: I agree. The case study states the computers in Sales department are managed by Intune and are Azure AD- joined. They don't seem have nothing to do with SCCM

discussion.content: b install script. just tested. the case you are reffering too is for existing devices that are in sccm. but in the case study they are talking about intune enrolled devices. windows 10. as i wrote i just tested and no install-module command is neccesary. this will get automatically installed if you choose to run get-windowsautopilotinfo -online command but if you choose out-file it will never get installed as it is not required

comments.content: My tip for this part of the exam is: Read first what they are asking, then go back and search for the specific information instead of reading everything wasting precious time. Sometimes the whole information is very complicated but the question is very simple.

discussion.content:
Answer is correct. Moderator please update the link provided to:
https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/mem/autopilot/existing-devices

A. Install-Module WindowsAutoPilotIntune is a PowerShell cmdlet that allows you to install the Windows Autopilot and Microsoft Intune modules, which provide tools and functionality for managing Windows devices through cloud-based device enrolment and configuration.

B. Install-Script Get-WindowsAutoPilotInfo is a PowerShell script that collects and exports information about a Windows device that is enrolled in the Microsoft Autopilot program. This script gathers hardware and configuration details that can be used to register the device with the Autopilot service, enabling automated deployment and provisioning of the device.

C. Import-AutoPilotCSV section within the "Install-Script Get-WindowsAutoPilotInfo" script is used to import device information from a CSV file into the Windows Autopilot service.

D. Get-WindowsAutoPilotInfo is a PowerShell cmdlet that retrieves information about a device's Windows Autopilot registration status, including its Autopilot profile and deployment state.

B. is correct.

Selected Answer: B
Also going for B here and tested it as well, running the install script works without installing the necessary module

Selected Answer: A
RodrigoT thank you for providing the correct link

comments.content: Which Windows PowerShell command should you run FIRST?

discussion.content: Answer should be: Install-Script Get-WindowsAutoPilotInfo

choices.D: Group1, Group2, Group3, and Group5 only
choices.E: Group1, Group2, Group3, and Group4 only

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: E
You can only manage cloud groups.

Selected Answer: E
E is Correct

Selected Answer: C
i meant C

Selected Answer: B
BBC available
I tried this on my tenant, and I couldn't add members to the distribution groups and the mail-enabled security groups. So, it's C.

comments.content: Agreed, tested in my tenant as well and the answer is B.

discussion.content:
Per microsoft docs: Some groups can't be managed in the Azure portal:

Groups synced from on-premises Active Directory can be managed only in on-premises Active Directory.
Distribution lists and mail-enabled security groups are managed only in Exchange admin center or Microsoft 365 admin center. You must sign in to Exchange admin center or Microsoft 365 admin center to manage these groups.
https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/azure/active-directory/fundamentals/concept-learn-about-groups

Selected Answer: E
Correct answer is E only cloud groups

Selected Answer: E
This should be E. You can't manage AD synced groups from AAD

comments.content: If you have a tenant you can check in you should double check this. You can definitely add users to distribution lists in Azure AD, I do it all the time.
You can't manage dist groups from here either. You can only do that from EAC or Office Admin portal so the answer should be C imo.

discussion.content: E, from Azure AD you can only add Security and Microsoft 365 groups but you can manage (edit) all groups except AD groups that are synced with local AD

Selected Answer: E
This should be E, unless the organization has group writeback enabled you cant manage AD groups in AAD

questions.question_text:
Your on-premises network contains an Active Directory domain that syncs with an Azure AD tenant. The tenant contains the groups shown in the following table.

//IMG//


You plan to add new members to each group.

Which groups can you manage in the Azure Active Directory admin center?
